intro: Galium parishii, commonly known as the Parish's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. The plant has slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
